title: Calories in White Wine
meta_description: Learn calories in white wine per standard glass, including carbs, alcohol impact, full nutrition breakdown, and serving tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc), 12% ABV; 150 ml serving size per glass; no added sugars or mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, brand, alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 150 ml glass of dry white wine contains about 123 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to sweet white wine (higher residual sugars)
Make a spritzer with soda water (dilutes by half)
Chilled and served in a smaller 100 ml pour

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: About 123 kcal for a standard 150 ml glass of dry white wine.
Yes, around 3.9 g carbs per 150 ml glass, mainly from natural sugars.

faqs.q: Calories in white wine vs red wine?
faqs.a: Similar; dry white and red both ~120-130 kcal per glass, varying by sweetness and ABV.

faqs.q: How does serving size affect calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Larger pours increase calories proportionally; 100 ml is ~82 kcal, 200 ml ~164 kcal.
